instructions.title: Citations in Chicago Manual of Style (Notes and Bibliography) with LaTeX and biblatex-chicago
instructions.description: This guide explains how to set up your LaTeX document for Chicago Manual of Style (Notes and Bibliography) citations using the biblatex-chicago package. Below are detailed instructions, code examples, and compilation steps using XeLaTeX.

step.title: Load the Package
step.description: Include the following in your document preamble to load the biblatex-chicago package with the necessary options for notes and bibliography style. The "notes" option enables Chicago-style footnotes, "backend=biber" specifies Biber as the processor, and "short" enables shortened citations on subsequent uses.

step.title: Add the Bibliography Resource
step.description: Register your bibliography file (e.g. references.bib) in the preamble.

step.title: Citing Sources in Your Document
step.description: Use the \autocite command to automatically generate Chicago-style footnotes (Notes and Bibliography style) for your citations. The first citation provides a full reference, and subsequent citations use a shortened format.

example.code: World War I had lasting impacts on Germany\autocite{GermanHistoryVersailles}.
Otto Dix depicted war as overwhelming destruction\autocite{UMMAArtilleryBattle}.

step.title: Print the Bibliography
step.description: At the end of your document, include the following command to display the complete bibliography.

step.title: Single Spacing in the Bibliography
step.description: To ensure that the bibliography is single-spaced, include the following command before printing the bibliography.

step.title: Compilation Instructions with XeLaTeX
step.description: To compile your document using XeLaTeX, follow these steps:

list.item: Run XeLaTeX on your document: xelatex essay.tex
Process the bibliography with Biber: biber essay
Run XeLaTeX again to update references: xelatex essay.tex
Run XeLaTeX one more time to ensure all citations are updated: xelatex essay.tex

combined.code: xelatex essay.tex && biber essay && xelatex essay.tex && xelatex essay.tex
